resources.string: Make new Envelopes, edit existing ones, or delete thm on this screen.
You can also change your Envelope order, budget period or budget amount. Then you can change the current balance in your Envelope by going to the Fill Envelopes screen.

Each envelope shows the balance remaining. The status bars show how "full" or (un -full…) your envelope is.

Tap the envelope bars to see a list of transactions in that envelope. From there you can edit a transaction.

To control the order of the envelopes on this screen find "Edit Envelopes" in the overflow menu or visit the website and drag and drop the envelopes on the Add/Edit Envelopes page.
Schedule this… (Requires a registered household. Head to the Envelopes screen to register.)

When your budgeting period is set to monthly, weekly, or semi-monthly, the black line on the expanded view shows you where "today" is.

If the green bar is to the right of the black line you are on target! If not, time to play catch up…

You can change your budgeting period in Settings.
Add to Quick Transactions widget\n(edit from Settings)

SmartBudget will suggest recent Payees that you have entered. Also, if you record at point-of-sale SmartBudget will help you the next time by suggesting Payees you have used that are located near where you are.
Use the Expense/Credit toggle to record these.

If you want to add a tag to an expense, you can use the "#" sign in the Notes field. For example, to mark tax-deductible expenses, put "#tax" in the notes. Or for expenses related to your car, tag it "#honda".
SmartBudget will remember your transaction location on your phone and auto-suggest the Payee, Envelope and Account the next time you are in the area. You can enable this feature in Settings.
Enter your paycheck as a new income. Choose "Fill Each Envelope" to fill your Envelope right away, or "Keep Unallocated\" to save it for later.
Fill your Envelope with money you previously kept Unallocated.

Choose "Add" to rollover an Envelope's current balance and add more to it 

Choose "Set" to not rollover and set the balance to a particular amount. 

For example, if an Envelope has a current balance of 10. 

Add 15 will bring the balance to 25. 

Set 15 will bring the balance to 15.
